meanings.definition: (Latin) to fashion, form, shape; to represent, portray, depict
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to fashion, form, shape; to represent, portray, depict

verb_forms.present_indicative: effingo, effingis, effingit, effingimus, effingitis, effingunt
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: effingebam, effingebas, effingebat, effingebamus, effingebatis, effingebant
verb_forms.future_indicative: effingam, effinges, effinget, effingemus, effingetis, effingent
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: effinxi, effinxisti, effinxit, effinximus, effinxistis, effinxerunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: effinxeram, effinxeras, effinxerat, effinxeramus, effinxeratis, effinxerant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: effinxero, effinxeris, effinxerit, effinxerimus, effinxeritis, effinxerint
verb_forms.present_subjunctive: effingam, effingas, effingat, effingamus, effingatis, effingant
verb_forms.imperfect_subjunctive: effingerem, effingeres, effingeret, effingeremus, effingeretis, effingerent
verb_forms.perfect_subjunctive: effinxerim, effinxeris, effinxerit, effinxerimus, effinxeritis, effinxerint
verb_forms.pluperfect_subjunctive: effinxissem, effinxisses, effinxisset, effinxissemus, effinxissetis, effinxissent

usage_notes.explanation: Effingere is a Latin verb that means to fashion, form, or shape something. It can also mean to represent, portray, or depict something, often in a creative or artistic way.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, so readability depends on the reader's familiarity with Latin.
